page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This block covers previous farming land which is being swallowed up by the need for space on which to build residential and industrial estates. It is an example of urban extension, in thiscase,south from Middlesbrough/ Thornaby.Also included is the junction of the new roadways acting as bypasses to connect the traffic flowing E/W and N/S.The area still retains some farm land,villages and settlements in the south.This would appear to be temporary as the rate of building is accelerating in the residential section.The new housing caters,mainly for private homes,the council owned houses being nearer the town centre. The central part has been allocated as land for industrial use but is, apparently, failing to attract much new industry.This block is a mix of farms,housing,industry and villages.
